intro: Bupleurum affine f. virgatum, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The leaves are typically alternate, pinnately divided, and have a slightly hairy surface. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, this plant thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
